title: The progress of the project for the payment of 30% of the Employees’ Provident Fund
decision_details: - Releasing of pre-benefits amounting to 30% from the Employees' Provident Fund (EPF) for housing activities and medical facilities was commenced in the mid 2015, in terms of the provisions of the Employees' Provident Fund Act, No.15 of 1958 as amended by the Act, No.2 of 2012. The Cabinet noted the information submitted by Hon. W.D.J. Seneviratne,  the Minister of Labour and Trade Union Relations, that 70,269 applications have been received up to now to obtain such benefits and sum of Rs. 5.5 billion has been released by now for 7,537 applications so received, that the action is being taken to provide benefits for the remaining applications without any delay, and that it has been planned to implement this process more productively in future.
